title: Are there any difference between 'forensic auditing' and 'forensic accounting'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Forensic is the process of gathering evidence to support a case or hipótesis. There is no actual forensic accounting, accounting is only accounting. However, profesionals on the field of forensic audit are call forensic accountants. Difference with a regular audit is that forensic audit knows that there is a fraud and is investigating causes, individuals, extent, where the assets went. Regular audit is only a certification of financial statements. A regular audit may end in a forensic audit if there is some fraud found.

FA includes fraud investigation among other things such as electronic tracing but auditing is one of the tools used for specific potential fraudulent acts as well many other tools such as interviewing.
